name: It's A Wipe!
description: A game of fantasy guild management! In It's A Wipe! you assume the role of a guild leader within a fantasy game world. You must recruit other players, lead them to victory against increasingly difficult odds, and make sure that your group remains happy enough to stick with you!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP or newer Processor: Anything that should run windows should run this Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Any Directx8 OpenGL Compatible card DirectX: Version 8.0 Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: Any OpenAL Compatible Card Additional Notes: The game is designed to be fairly light weight.  It should run on almost any system.

reviews.review_text: UPDATE November 13th 2015: It has been over a month. (10/9 - 11/13) That I have been talking with the maker(s?) of this game discussing the issues I'm having getting it to run, and finally we got it working with the new 'debugging-' patch they added to the games betas list. Let that sink in for a moment, these people love their game so much, and are so willing to get it to work for those that purchase it, that even a single person like myself is worth that much time and effort. Now, once I've actually played the game a bit, I'll be reviewing it properly, but whether the game itself is good or bad now is now irrelivant to me; fun is subjective and will change from person to person, but dev(s) willing to put this much effort into fixing a game for you, that's the kind of work that deserves to be paid for.   Original Review: I don't want to give it a negative review because the developer has been nice so far; but the game simply won't run, even on different video cards. Will happily change when/if I ever get it working because it looks like a blast. :(
For anyone that's interested in a statistical single player version of an MMORPG then this isn't a bad option. I'd recommend waiting for a 50% off sale.

I would thumbs up this game but for what seems to be a game-breaking bug. You cannot control which tank tanks the enemies. Despite there being a Tank screen where you set up who tanks what, *and* a Tank Switch command once the raid starts, it does nothing, and the tank that the enemies decide to attack will be killed because of this. Shame.  EDIT: Dev reponded within hours of my review and fixed this bug. Impressive!
All i can say about this game is that i want more of it, perhaps a bit more developed and complex
Absolutely love it! It's a great game for such a price. Very humorous but also challenging. I can only recommend it.

I used to love World of Warcraft and was a hardcore 5 to 6 day a week raider for years...before it went to ♥♥♥♥ (around the time they decided to add panda people and pretty much give raid quality gear to any no-skill-having tool that payed their $15 a month).
